reviewText: --------------------------------------------------------------------"Bonanza: The Official Complete Fourth Season" (1962-63)(CBS Home Video, 2012)--------------------------------------------------------------------This is classic American TV from the early 1960s, the fourth season of NBC's "Bonanza" western series, starring Lorne Greene, Michael Landon, Dan Blocker and Pernell Roberts as the Cartwright family, whose vast acreage near Lake Tahoe provided them with fourteen years worth of adventure, drama and comedy between 1959-73. By the time of this 1962-63 season, the Bonanza "schtick" was falling firmly into place, with the characters becoming better defined, and the comedic interplay between the actors getting more polished. Lorne Greene, as the family patriarch Ben Cartwright, is still relatively vigorous and youthful (at least compared to later seasons) while Landon's "Little Joe" is still being played as a callow young'un... The actor who hasn't quite hit his stride yet is Dan Blocker: I think "Hoss" continued to get better and better as the series went along, and in many ways he was the show's real hero.  Well, anyway, everybody has their favorites, right?Fans will be pleased with these high-quality video transfers, which also have good sound quality and a lot of footage restored from the shortened versions seen in syndication over the years... It's particularly fun to see all the old "bumpers" and some of the ads and promotional clips from the original broadcasts, including the '62-'63 vintage NBC peacock logos: pop culture fans should get a real kick out of this stuff! Nice, old-fashioned entertainment from the Kennedy era... (DJ Joe Sixpack, Slipcue film reviews)

reviewText: I Love It because it brings me back to my youth when the only color TV shows were Bonanza and the Wonderful World of Disney. My Sister Sue had the First color TV set in the Family and we use to gather around it in the early 60's and watch these show's every Sunday night. It became tradition till my Dad finally got a color set.Bonanza will always be one of my favorite TV westerns of all time!! It's diversity of Human events and the Stars that perform them will live on forever in the annals of Television Classics...

reviewText: Dear TV Fans....I GREW UP with Bonanza...so I don't have to review the DVD to tell you it was a FIVE STAR SERIES!!!! (Regarding the actual show )  IT IS!!! So I just wanted to put in my 2 cents.....Watching ALL 14 Seasons of Bonanza is like putting on an old worn pair of Jeans...or anything that makes you comfortable. ..(I DO wish it was on BluRay .... not necessarily for any aspect ratio changes, as I am a purist...but for disc space and clarity....I am pretty sure the master tapes would allow this but even with that said ...watching DVD on a Great set (upconverted or not is Dam Good!! :) so I would not worry! ..........with that said....I would tell ALL people who didn't grow up with this series while it was being broadcast...it was a very special Sunday evening..Buy Them ALL!!I would also tell you to get EVERY SINGLE SEASON of Gunsmoke (20 Years on the air), The Twilight Zone (The Best TV Series In History), The Honeymooners (The Original 39 episodes),The Dick Van Dyke Show, I Love Lucy and ALL the original Mary Tyler Moore Shows.......This is when WRITERS meant something....They were briliant  There used to be 36 episodes in aseason "The comedic and dramatic acting abilities (especially in their early years)were incredible.The Writers....The producers actually cared about quality.....not the crap cheaply produced "reality shows" they have now which replaced real quality for financial purposes...(I am not talking about HBO or Premium shows...They are amazing)........There are OTHERS ...of Course...but I wanted to mention 7 of the best in History.....(Sorry.......One More  HAVE GUN WILL TRAVEL......and in another Genre...The Tonight Show With JOHNNY CARSON...(who will always be the Best in TV History at what he did and every current Talk show host will Verify that!!) ALL TV SERIES MENTIONED HERE ARE 5 STARS!! NO DOUBT ABOUT IT!!***AS A FELLOW ENTHUSIAST POINTED OUT I TOTALLY BLANKED ON  "THE FUGITIVE"  A RARE MASTERWORK IN TV SERIES HISTORY!!!AND INCONTRAVERTIBLY.......... ONE OF THE GREATEST SERIES OF ALL TIME!!(The Original "MISSION IMPOSSIBLE" TV Series WITH PETER GRAVES WASN"T TOO SHABBY EITHER  :)ENJOY!!!!AG In New York :)

reviewText: Once again, Bonanza Ventures has done a spectacular job in getting these uncut episodes to DVD. It is so much fun to watch the episode and then hear what some of the guest stars have to say about their time on the show.  Victor French, who later played Mr.Edwards in Little House on the Prairie, has a guest starring role in this season. The Official releases of Bonanza just keep getting better and better. :)
